meanings.definition: Either of the two fleshy parts that form the upper and lower edges of the opening of the mouth.
meanings.sent1: She applied lipstick to her lip before going out.
meanings.sent2: His lower lip trembled as he tried to hold back tears.
meanings.sent3: The baby's lip quivered as she prepared to cry.
meanings.sent4: Her lip curled in disdain at the rude comment.
meanings.sent5: The redness of her lip stood out against her pale skin.

meanings.definition: The edge of a hollow container or an opening.
meanings.sent1: The cup's lip was chipped, making it difficult to drink from.
meanings.sent2: She sipped from the mug, careful not to touch the hot lip.
meanings.sent3: The lip of the bottle was sticky from spilled juice.
meanings.sent4: He carefully poured the liquid up to the lip of the glass.
meanings.sent5: The lip of the jar was sealed tightly to keep the contents fresh.

meanings.definition: A projecting edge on a tool or implement.
meanings.sent1: The screwdriver's lip helped grip the stubborn screw.
meanings.sent2: He used the lip of the can opener to puncture the lid.
meanings.sent3: The sharp lip of the knife made it easy to cut through the tough meat.
meanings.sent4: The shovel's lip made it easier to scoop up the dirt.
meanings.sent5: The hammer's lip was perfect for pulling out nails.
